name: N-Octyloctan-1-amine
Reason: 1-Octanamine has a melting point around 10°C. The introduction of the octyl group (C1CCCCCC1) increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, which raises the melting point by approximately +20°C. The amine group introduces hydrogen bonding potential, which can further lower the melting point by approximately -10°C. Summing up these changes: +20°C for the octyl group and -10°C for the amine group.
